definition: few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom

sentences.english: Today, few people would seem to subscribe to this view.
sentences.chinese: 今天，似乎鲜少有人喜欢这种理论了。

sentences.english: The career principles in the books are also of limited use.
sentences.chinese: 此外，书中所说的职场原则也鲜少有用武之地。

sentences.english: Few people think of encyclopedias as creative enterprises; but they are.
sentences.chinese: 鲜少有人想到百科全书是创意的工作，但它确实是。

sentences.english: Few of the things more confident-seeming people do are perfect either.
sentences.chinese: 那些看起来很自信的人也鲜少能把事情做到完美。

sentences.english: Massive infestation of Sarcoptes mites is rarely observed, especially in the scalp area.
sentences.chinese: 大量的疥虫感染鲜少发生在头皮。

sentences.english: Carrie rarely admits to her mistakes.
Love Hasty marriage seldom proves well.
sentences.chinese: 爱情草率结婚，鲜少美满。

sentences.english: Its flowers are small and white, but it rarely blooms.
sentences.chinese: 它的花苞小巧莹白，却鲜少开放。

sentences.english: Denim is one area in which some of the most fundamental rules of the global economy don't appear to apply.
sentences.chinese: 牛仔业，是一个鲜少运用全球化经济基本准则的行业。

sentences.english: All the scholars, both at home and abroad, rarely studied speech roles from the perspective of "power".
sentences.chinese: 国内外学者鲜少从权势的角度对话语角色进行研究。

sentences.english: The amount awarded by the court will rarely pay the full amount of the attorney fees.
sentences.chinese: 但是法院判定的数目鲜少能够支付全额的律师费用。

sentences.english: Men seldom make passes at girls who wear glasses.
sentences.chinese: 男人鲜少留意戴眼镜的女生。

sentences.english: That resource is rarely mentioned in the debate on the future of oil.
sentences.chinese: 但在关于石油未来的争论中，鲜少有人提及这些资源。

definition: just a very few (idiom); tiny number/just a handful/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.
just a very few (idiom); tiny number/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.
can be counted on one's fingers (idiom)/very few
to show one's face/to appear (in public)
always (previously)/a period of time in the recent past
